snippet: Two top Chinese officials will not attend international financial meetings in Tokyo this week, seemingly an effort to show displeasure with Japan’s handling of a dispute over islands claimed by the two nations.
abstract: Two top Chinese officials will not attend annual meetings of the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank held in Tokyo, in apparent effort to show displeasure with Japan’s handling of dispute over East China Sea islands claimed by the two nations.

byline.contributor: Keith Bradsher contributed reporting from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: Two top Chinese officials will not attend international financial meetings in Tokyo this week, seemingly an effort to show displeasure with Japan’s handling of a dispute over islands claimed by the two nations.

headline.seo: China Snubs Financial Meetings in Japan in Dispute Over Islands
headline.main: China Snubs Financial Meetings in Japan in Dispute Over Islands
headline.print_headline: China Snubs Financial Meetings in Japan in Dispute Over Islands
